alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:32PM PST until December 05 at 11:45PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River Above Doty affecting Lewis County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including La Push, McDonald Bridge, Sequim, Potlatch, Satsop, Montesano...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the South West Region...including Mud Mtn. Dam Outflow, R Street Bridge, South Prairie, Fairfax, Orting, Puyallup, National, McKenna, Rainier, Packwood, Randle, Mayfield Dam...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Bucoda, Centralia, Chehalis, Doty, Centralia, Grand Mound, Porter...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Doty. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 316.5 feet, flood waters of the upper Chehalis and South Fork Chehalis will spill over its banks...inundating low flood prone areas and possibly some roads below Doty and in the Boisfort Valley. This stage roughly corresponds to Phase 1 in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 317.8 feet. - Flood stage is 318.0 feet. - Forecast...The river fell below flood stage this afternoon and is expected to continue to fall. Flooding will continue until the flood wave has passed downstream. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
